title: Samsung introduces new models of Gear VR headset and Gear 360 camera
text:
Samsung introduces new models of Gear VR headset and Gear 360 camera Samsung introduces new models of Gear VR headset and Gear 360 camera By - March 30, 2017 “Samsung’s new Gear VR features a controller, while the Gear 360 can now shoot in 4K” 
In addition to the Galaxy S8 and Galaxy S8+ flagships , Samsung yesterday also introduced the new models of the Gear VR headset and Gear 360 sphere camera at its unpacked event. The new Gear VR is the first in the series with a controller, and is powered by Oculus. The Gear 360 (2017) camera comes with a new mushroom-shaped design, which makes it easy for users to hold and take selfies. 
As per Samsung, the new Gear VR controller features an ergonomic design with foam cushioning and a stable and secure strap holder. The wireless controller of the wearable has a clickable touchpad, volume rocker, navigation buttons and a trigger key. Samsung says the touchpad makes it easy to navigate the UI and interact with VR games and apps. 
The Gear VR with Controller comes with a USB Type-C port, a microUSB port and Bluetooth 4.2. It is compatible with the Galaxy S8 , S8+ , S7 , S7 edge , S6 , S6 edge , S6 edge+ and Note5 . Samsung’s partner Oculus said that there will be 20 compatible games that support the controller next month, and 50 more titles in the next couple of months. 
As for the Gear 360 (2017), it is capable of capturing true 4K videos in 360-degree. For comparison, its predecessor could only capture in near-4K quality. The new Gear 360 is also capable of live-streaming 2K videos. The captured live stream is first sent to a compatible smartphone and is then uploaded to either YouTube or Facebook as a “Live Broadcast”. 
The Gear 360 (2017) gets two 8.4-megapixel image sensors, each attached to dual fisheye lenses with an aperture of f/2.2 on all the lenses. It features a 1,160mAh battery, microSD card support up to 256GB, dual-band Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.1 and a USB Type-C port. It comes with gyro and accelerometer sensors, and gets IP53 certification for dust and splash resistance. The accessory is compatible with the Galaxy S8 series, S7 series and S6 series, the Note5, A7 (2017) , iPhone 7 , iPhone 6 , iPhone SE , and Windows and Mac computers. 
Coming to the pricing and availability, the Gear VR with Controller has been priced at $129 (approximately Rs 8,400), and will be available from April 21st. If you already have the previous Gear VR, then you can purchase the new controller separately for $39 (approximately Rs 2,600). There’s no word on the pricing of the Gear 360 (2017) at the moment, but Samsung says the camera might start shipping in late April / May time frame. Facebook Comments
